sentence.Network_en: Alliss retired from golf in 1969 and went on to become a successful broadcaster.

sentence.Network_en: A well - known broadcaster has been asked to commentate on the opening ceremony of the national games.
sentence.Network_cn: 一位著名的播音员已被请去实况报道全运会的开幕式.

sentence.Network_en: Now do the same for a show made by a foreign broadcaster.
sentence.Network_cn: 那么,同样的举动对外国广播电视公司制作的影片做一遍.

entry.tran: （电台或电视台的）广播员，播音员，节目主持人
entry.def: A broadcaster is someone who gives talks or takes part in interviews and discussions on radio or television programmes.

example.ex: ...the prominent naturalist and broadcaster, Sir David Attenborough.

means.word_mean: 1. someone who broadcasts on radio or television
2. a mechanical device for scattering something (seed or fertilizer or sand etc.) in all directions
